for [1,2,3] how come bob always wins. what if the scenario goes this way
alice remove 3 stones  -> [1,2,0]
bob remove 2 stones -> [1,0,0]
Alice remove 1 stone -> [0,0,0]
bob has no stones left to remove so he lose the game. 
expected should be true

They always find their respective optimal solutions, and they can remove any positive number of stones.
for your example:
alice remove 3 stones -> [1,2,0]
bob remove 1 stones -> [1,1,0]
Alice remove 1 stone -> [0,1,0]
bob remove 1 stones -> [0,0,0]
So, Bob wins.
